TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PromptEmphasis extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates values for levels of emphasis in prompts.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Members of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> enumeration are used by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle.%23ctor%2A> constructor, by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptBuilder.AppendText%2A> method, and by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptBuilder.StartStyle%2A> method to specify the level of emphasis for spoken text. The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle.Emphasis%2A> property gets the emphasis for a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptStyle> object using a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> instance.
> [!NOTE] > The speech synthesis engines in Windows do not support variations in the emphasis of speech output at this time. Setting values for emphasis using a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> enumeration will produce no audible change in the synthesized speech output.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis Moderate = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates a moderate level of emphasis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis None = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis NotSet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that no emphasis value is specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis Reduced = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Indicates a reduced level of emphasis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis Strong = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates a strong level of emphasis.
